result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin Theodore Pettis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (>1-5g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1r.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (>1-5g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1r.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AS TO EACH COUNT/CASE:  Court costs and victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.  To be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid by 2/5/22.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence, but concurrent with  count five. Credit for one day.

superMiscConds.notes: Successfully complete a cognitive thinking behavioral modification program.

AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens and breathalyzers.  No alcohol or controlled substances.
**Conditions of ES apply to both counts.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer user or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence, but concurrent with  count four. Credit for one day.

records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to Drug Abuse Correctional Center Attn. Stephanie P.O.Box 36 Winnebago, WI 54985-0036

Certification of transcript of proceedings of SENTENCING HEARING commencing FEBRUARY 5, 2015 received and filed. (38 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to DANIEL SANDERS ATTORNEY AT LAW.

Defendant Kevin Theodore Pettis in court with attorney Daniel H Sanders.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 4:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 7 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 4 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, but concurrent to Count 5, credit for 1 day.
AS TO COUNT 5:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 7 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 4 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, but concurrent to Count 4, credit for 1 day.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 2/5/2022; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 2/5/2022; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Employment or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-6 month drivers license suspension as to COunt 4
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
to Adjourn Sentencing date, received and filed. sab

Defendant Kevin Theodore Pettis in court with attorney Daniel H. Sanders.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his/her civil rights are restored.
Case calendared for SENTENCING on 12/22/2014 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.
